issue.title: Only use base styles in overrides stylesheet

repository.name: nhsuk-service-manual
repository.description: Design and build digital services for the NHS. Use the service manual to build consistent, usable services that put people first.â€‹ Learn from the research and experience of other NHS teams.

issue.body:
## Description

This PR updates **design-example-overrides.css** to exclude NHS.UK frontend styles

Only the following "base" styles are safe from side effects (e.g. mixins, functions only)

```scss
@forward 'nhsuk-frontend/packages/core/settings';
@forward 'nhsuk-frontend/packages/core/tools';
```

These nested paths didn't work with `pkg:` so I've opened a Dart Sass issue:

* https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/4080

## Checklist
<!-- Ensure each of the points below have been considered and completed where applicable -->

- [ ] Tested against the [NHS.UK frontend testing policy](https://github.com/nhsuk/nhsuk-frontend/blob/main/docs/contributing/testing.md) (Resolution, Browser & Accessibility)
- [ ] Code follows the [NHS.UK frontend coding standards](https://github.com/nhsuk/nhsuk-frontend/blob/main/docs/contributing/coding-standards.md)
- [ ] Version number has been increased in `package.json` (using [SEMVER](https://semver.org/))
- [ ] CHANGELOG entry
- [ ] [Whats new page](https://service-manual.nhs.uk/whats-new) entry

issue.title: Allow the Node.js pkg importer to return the same URL multiple times
issue.body:
Previously, if multiple URLs were found by this importer, it would
throw an error even if every URL was identical (for example if there
were multiple routes to the same file). This now allows multiple URLs
as long as they're not distinct.

This is a fast-track proposal.

Closes #4080

issue.title: Allow the Node.js pkg importer to return the same URL multiple times
Allow the Node.js pkg importer to return the same URL multiple times

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

body:
Bit of a follow up for other users needing duplicate resolutions for compatibility

Using the `"sass": null` suggestion with [webpack `sass-loader`](https://webpack.js.org/loaders/sass-loader/) throws:

```console
ERROR in ./styles/design-example-overrides.scss
Module build failed (from ../node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
Can't find stylesheet to import.
```

But the tweaks below are compatible down to:

1. [Sass 1.72.0](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#1720) with webpack [`sass-loader@14.1.1`](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/releases/tag/v14.1.1)
2. [Sass 1.89.0](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#1890) with CLI flag `--pkg-importer node`

```patch
{
  "exports": {
    ".": {
      "sass": "./packages/index.scss",
      "default": "./packages/index.js"
    },
     "./*": "./*",
     "./packages/*": {
-      "sass": "./packages/*.scss",
+      "sass": "./packages/*",
       "default": "./packages/*.js"
     },
     "./packages/*.js": "./packages/*.js",
-    "./packages/*.scss": "./packages/*.scss",
     "./package.json": "./package.json"
   }
 }
```

issue.title: Support webpack `sass-loader` pkg: scheme with nested paths

repository.name: nhsuk-frontend
repository.description: NHS.UK frontend contains the code you need to start building user interfaces for NHS websites and services.

issue.body:
## Description

This PR updates our [package entry points](https://github.com/nhsuk/nhsuk-frontend/pull/1261) to support nested paths in:

1. [Sass 1.72.0](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#1720) with webpack [`sass-loader@14.1.1`](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/releases/tag/v14.1.1)
2. [Sass 1.89.0](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#1890) with CLI flag `--pkg-importer node`

For example using:

```scss
@forward 'pkg:nhsuk-frontend/packages/core/settings';
@forward 'pkg:nhsuk-frontend/packages/core/tools';
```

This is possible because Sass always handles file extensions and `_` partial prefixes, unlike webpack

See issue https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/4080 for more information

## Checklist

- [ ] Tested against our [testing policy](https://github.com/nhsuk/nhsuk-frontend/blob/master/docs/contributing/testing.md) (Resolution, Browser & Accessibility)
- [x] Follows our [coding standards and style guide](https://github.com/nhsuk/nhsuk-frontend/blob/master/docs/contributing/coding-standards.md)
- [x] CHANGELOG entry
